intro: Deppea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed deppea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, often emitting a mild fragrance. Deppea longipes is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
